name: src/all.js
all
description:
Tests if a function holds true for all elements in an iterable. 
Always returns true for an empty iterable. 
This function is curried.

params.name: f
params.description: The condition to test for each element.

name: src/any.js
any
description:
Tests if a function holds true for any of the elements in an iterable. 
Always returns false for an empty iterable. 
This function is curried.

params.name: f
params.description: The condition to test for each element.

name: src/append.js
append
description:
Appends an object to the end of an iterable sequence. 
This function is curried.

name: src/buffer.js
buffer
description:
Takes an iterable and returns a new iterable with all of the same elements but with a memory buffer. 
This can be used to prevent repeated computations.

name: src/chunk.js
chunk
description:
Splits an iterable into chunks of a given size. 
The last chunk may be less than the specified size. 
This function is curried.

name: src/concat.js
concat
description:
Concatenates two iterables into one.  
This function is curried.

name: src/count.js
count
description: Counts the number of elements in an iterable.

name: src/default-comparison.js
src/default-equality.js
src/empty.js
empty
description: An empty iterable.

name: src/filter.js
filter
description:
Takes an iterable and returns a new one including only elements that satisfy a given predicate.  
The order of the iterable is maintained. 
This function is curried.

name: src/first.js
first
description:
Returns the first element of an iterable that satisfies a given predicate.   
This function will throw an error if no satisfactory element is found.  
This function is curried.

params.name: f
params.description: The predicate, defaults to always true.

name: src/flat-map.js
flatMap
description:
Takes an iterable and returns a new one where each element is transformed using the given function.  
Unlike map, the function is expected to return an iterable for each element. These iterables are concatenated. 
The order of the iterable is maintained. 
This function is curried.

params.name: f
params.description: The transformation function that returns an iterable.

name: src/forever.js
forever
description:
Given an iterable returns a new iterable that repeats it forever. 
Take care, since the resulting iterable is infinite.

name: src/from-array.js
fromArray
description:
Given an array, returns an iterable with equivalent elements. 
You should not mutate the array used to create the iterable.

name: src/from-generator.js
fromGenerator
description: Given a generator function, returns an iterable with equivalent elements.

name: src/head.js
head
description:
Returns the first element of an iterable. 
If the iterable is empty then an error is thrown.

name: src/includes.js
includes
description:
Tests if a an iterable contains a given element. 
Also takes an equality object as an optional argument. 
This function is partially curried.

name: src/index.js
src/indexed.js
src/is-iterable.js
isIterable
description: Tests if a given object is an iterable

name: src/join.js
join
description:
Joins all elements in an iterable using the given seperator. 
If the iterable is empty then the empty string is returned.

name: src/just.js
just
description:
Constructs an iterable from a fixed list of elements. 
This function is variadic.

name: src/last.js
last
description:
Returns the last element of an iterable that satisfies a given predicate.   
This function will throw an error if no satisfactory element is found.  
This function is curried.

params.name: f
params.description: The predicate, defaults to always true.

name: src/map.js
map
description:
Takes an iterable and returns a new one where each element is transformed using the given function.  
The order of the iterable is maintained. 
This function is curried.

name: src/max.js
max
description:
Takes an iterable and returns the largest element, according to the given comparison. 
This function is curried.

name: src/min.js
min
description:
Takes an iterable and returns the smallest element, according to the given comparison. 
This function is curried.

name: src/none.js
none
description:
Tests if a function holds true for none of the elements in an iterable. 
Always returns true for an empty iterable. 
By default, this function returns false for an iterable with any elements. 
This function is curried.

params.name: f
params.description: The condition to test for each element.

name: src/nth.js
nth
description:
Returns the nth element of an iterable.    
This function will throw an error if the iterable is not long enough.  
This function is curried.

params.name: n
params.description: The zero-based index of the element to return.

name: src/once.js
once
description:
Takes an iterable and returns a new iterable that may only be iterated once. 
This function is useful for debugging purposes.

name: src/prepend.js
prepend
description:
Prepends an object to the start of an iterable sequence. 
This function is curried.

name: src/range.js
range
description: Creates an iterable of numbers from zero to the given limit.

name: src/reduce.js
reduce
description:
Performs a reduction of an iterable, starting from a given state and reducer function. 
Note that this function must not be called on an infinite iterable. 
This function is partially curried.

name: src/remove.js
remove
description:
Takes an iterable and returns a new iterable where
the nth element has been skipped.  
This function is curried.

params.name: n
params.description: The index of the element to replace.

name: src/repeat.js
repeat
description:
Repeats an iterable for the given number of times. 
This function is curried.

name: src/reverse.js
reverse
description:
Given an iterable, returns a new iterable with the elements reversed. 
Note that this function must not be called on an infinite iterable.

name: src/set.js
set
description:
Takes an iterable and returns a new iterable where
the nth element has been set to a given value.  
This function is curried.

params.name: n
params.description: The index of the element to replace.

name: src/single.js
single
description:
Returns the first element of an iterable that satisfies a given predicate.   
This function will throw an error if no satisfactory element is found.  
This function is curried.

params.name: f
params.description: The predicate, defaults to always true.

name: src/skip-until.js
skipUntil
description:
Skips elements from an iterable for as long as the elements satisfy a given condition. 
The first element that satisfies the condition will be included. 
This function is curried.

name: src/skip.js
skip
description:
Skips the first n elements of an iterable. 
If there are fewer than n elements in an iterable, then an empty iterable will be returned. 
This function is curried.

params.name: n
params.description: The number of elements to skip.

name: src/smoosh.js
smoosh
description:
Deep flattens an iterable and all of its nested iterables. 
Strings are not considered iterables for this function.

name: src/sorted-by-desc.js
src/sorted-by.js
src/sorted.js
sorted
description:
Given an iterable, returns a new iterable with the elements sorted. 
Note that this function must not be called on an infinite iterable.

name: src/strict-equality.js
src/stringify-equality.js
src/structural-equality/hash-code.js
src/structural-equality/index.js
src/structural-equality/is-equal.js
src/sum.js
sum
description:
Sums all elements in an iterable. 
If the iterable is empty then zero is returned.

name: src/tail.js
tail
description:
Returns an iterable of all elements except the first. 
If the iterable is empty then an error is thrown.

name: src/take-while.js
takeWhile
description:
Takes elements from an iterable for as long as the elements satisfy a given condition. 
The first element that does satisfies the condition will not be included. 
This function is curried.

name: src/take.js
take
description:
Takes the first n elements of an iterable. 
If there are fewer than n elements in an iterable, then this has no effect. 
This function is curried.

params.name: n
params.description: The number of elements to take.

name: src/to-array.js
toArray
description:
Takes an iterable and converts it into an array. 
This should only be called on finite iterables.

name: src/to-set.js
toSet
description:
Takes an iterable and converts it into a set. 
This should only be called on finite iterables.

name: src/unique.js
unique
description:
Takes an iterable and returns a new one with duplicate elements removed.  
The order of the iterable is maintained. 
This function is curried.

name: src/update.js
update
description:
Takes an iterable and returns a new iterable where
the nth element has been updated with the given function.  
This function is curried.

params.name: n
params.description: The index of the element to replace.

name: src/zip.js
zip
description:
Combines two iterables into one by pairing elements. 
Each pair is a two element array. 
The longer of the two iterables will be truncated to match the length of the shorter one.  
This function is curried.

params.name: ys
params.description: The iterable whose elements will be the second element of the pairs.

params.name: xs
params.description: The iterable whose elements will be the first element of the pairs.

content:
# seq

A simple library for manipulating generators and arrays in JavaScript. 

[![Travis](https://img.shields.io/travis/njlr/seq.svg)](https://travis-ci.org/njlr/seq) 

## Get Started

Install using [Yarn](https://yarnpkg.com/): 

```bash=
yarn add @njlr/seq
```

Install using [NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/): 


```bash=
npm install --save @njlr/seq
```

You can [browse the documentation on GitHub](https://njlr.github.io/seq/).


## Why? 

 * Some of the built-in Array functions are mutating (e.g. `Array.prototype.sort`). 
 * Many array functions are missing. Where is `Array.prototype.flatMap`?
 * A chain of array functions creates a new array at every stage: the operations are not lazy. 
 * [lodash](https://lodash.com/) and [friends](https://github.com/jussi-kalliokoski/trine) require either a wrapper object or binding for chaining calls. We use the [pipeline operator](https://github.com/babel/babel/tree/master/packages/babel-plugin-proposal-pipeline-operator) (`|>`) to achieve this at compile-time! 
 * This package is a good citizen. It has no dependencies and does not mutate any global objects. 


## Demo

```javascript=
import * as seq from '@njlr/seq';

const x = [ 1, 5, 1, 2, 7, 3, 3, 4, 5, 0 ] 
  |> seq.unique()
  |> seq.map(x => x * 2)
  |> seq.filter(x => x > 4)
  |> seq.sorted()
  |> seq.toArray;

// x is [ 6, 8, 10, 14 ]
```

Since seq works on iterables, you can also use `for...of` loops:

```javascript=
import * as seq from '@njlr/seq';

for (const x of seq.range(10) |> seq.map(x => x * x)) {
  console.log(x);
}
```

This library also plays nicely with spread syntax! 

```javascript=
const squares = [ ... seq.range(10) |> seq.map(x => x * x) ];
```


## Development

Dependencies are managed by Yarn: 

```bash=
yarn install --pure-lockfile
```

To run all tests:

```bash=
yarn test
```

To build the library:

```bash=
yarn build
```

To build the documentation: 

```bash=
yarn docs
```

To release a new version:

```bash=
npm publish --access public 
```
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "@njlr/seq",
  "version": "3.6.0",
  "entry": "./src/index.js",
  "main": "./lib/index.js",
  "repository": "git@github.com:njlr/seq.git",
  "author": "njlr <njlr@users.noreply.github.com>",
  "license": "MIT",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "rollup -c",
    "docs": "rm -rf docs && esdoc",
    "test": "jest",
    "prepublishOnly": "yarn test && yarn build"
  },
  "jest": {
    "testURL": "http://localhost"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "^7.0.0-beta.40",
    "@babel/node": "^7.0.0-beta.40",
    "@babel/plugin-proposal-pipeline-operator": "^7.0.0-beta.40",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.0.0-beta.40",
    "core-js": "^3.4.1",
    "esdoc": "^1.0.4",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-importpath-plugin": "^1.0.1",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "jest": "^24.9.0",
    "regenerator-runtime": "^0.11.1",
    "rollup": "^1.27.1",
    "rollup-plugin-babel": "^4.0.0-beta.0"
  }
}
name: package.json
